name: AnyBidirectionalCollection
desc: A type-erased wrapper over any collection with indices that support bidirectional traversal.

items.name: typealias AnyBidirectionalCollection.Index
items.desc: A type that represents a position in the collection.

items.name: typealias AnyBidirectionalCollection.Indices
items.desc: A type that represents the indices that are valid for subscripting the collection, in ascending order.

items.name: typealias AnyBidirectionalCollection.Iterator
items.desc: A type that provides the collection’s iteration interface and encapsulates its iteration state.

items.name: typealias AnyBidirectionalCollection.SubSequence
items.desc: A collection representing a contiguous subrange of this collection’s elements. The subsequence shares indices with the original collection.

items.name: init(AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>)
items.desc: Creates an AnyBidirectionalCollection having the same underlying collection as other.

items.name: init(AnyRandomAccessCollection<Element>)
items.desc: Creates an AnyBidirectionalCollection having the same underlying collection as other.

items.name: init?(AnyCollection<Element>)
items.desc: Creates an AnyBidirectionalCollection having the same underlying collection as other.

items.name: init<C>(C)
items.desc: Creates a type-erased collection that wraps the given collection.

items.name: init<C>(C)
items.desc: Creates a type-erased collection that wraps the given collection.

items.name: var count: Int
items.desc: The number of elements.

items.name: var endIndex: AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index
items.desc: The collection’s “past the end” position—that is, the position one greater than the last valid subscript argument.

items.name: var first: Element?
items.desc: The first element of the collection.

items.name: var indices: DefaultIndices<AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>>
items.desc: The indices that are valid for subscripting the collection, in ascending order.

items.name: var isEmpty: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the collection is empty.

items.name: var last: Element?
items.desc: The last element of the collection.

items.name: var lazy: LazySequence<AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>>
items.desc: A sequence containing the same elements as this sequence, but on which some operations, such as map and filter, are implemented lazily.

items.name: var startIndex: AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index
items.desc: The position of the first element in a non-empty collection.

items.name: var underestimatedCount: Int
items.desc: A value less than or equal to the number of elements in the sequence, calculated nondestructively.

items.name: func allSatisfy((Element) -> Bool) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether every element of a sequence satisfies a given predicate.

items.name: func compactMap<ElementOfResult>((Element) -> ElementOfResult?) -> [ElementOfResult]
items.desc: Returns an array containing the non-nil results of calling the given transformation with each element of this sequence.

items.name: func contains(Element) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the sequence contains the given element.

items.name: func contains(where: (Element) -> Bool) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the sequence contains an element that satisfies the given predicate.

items.name: func difference<C>(from: C) -> CollectionDifference<Element>
items.desc: Returns the difference needed to produce this collection’s ordered elements from the given collection.

items.name: func difference<C>(from: C, by: (C.Element, Element) -> Bool) -> CollectionDifference<Element>
items.desc: Returns the difference needed to produce this collection’s ordered elements from the given collection, using the given predicate as an equivalence test.

items.name: func distance(from: AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index, to: AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index) -> Int
items.desc: Returns the distance between two indices.

items.name: func elementsEqual<OtherSequence>(OtherSequence) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this sequence and another sequence contain the same elements in the same order.

items.name: func elementsEqual<OtherSequence>(OtherSequence, by: (Element, OtherSequence.Element) -> Bool) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this sequence and another sequence contain equivalent elements in the same order, using the given predicate as the equivalence test.

items.name: func enumerated() -> EnumeratedSequence<AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>>
items.desc: Returns a sequence of pairs (n, x), where n represents a consecutive integer starting at zero and x represents an element of the sequence.

items.name: func first(where: (Element) -> Bool) -> Element?
items.desc: Returns the first element of the sequence that satisfies the given predicate.

items.name: func firstIndex(of: Element) -> AnyIndex?
items.desc: Returns the first index where the specified value appears in the collection.

items.name: func firstIndex(where: (Element) -> Bool) -> AnyIndex?
items.desc: Returns the first index in which an element of the collection satisfies the given predicate.

items.name: func flatMap<SegmentOfResult>((Element) -> SegmentOfResult) -> [SegmentOfResult.Element]
items.desc: Returns an array containing the concatenated results of calling the given transformation with each element of this sequence.

items.name: func formIndex(inout AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index, offsetBy: Int, limitedBy: AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index) -> Bool
func formIndex(after: inout AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index)
items.desc: Replaces the given index with its successor.

items.name: func formIndex(before: inout AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index)
items.desc: Replaces the given index with its predecessor.

items.name: func index(AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index, offsetBy: Int) -> AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index
items.desc: Returns an index that is the specified distance from the given index.

items.name: func index(AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index, offsetBy: Int, limitedBy: AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index) -> AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index?
items.desc: Returns an index that is the specified distance from the given index, unless that distance is beyond a given limiting index.

items.name: func index(after: AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index) -> AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index
items.desc: Returns the position immediately after the given index.

items.name: func index(before: AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index) -> AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index
items.desc: Returns the position immediately before the given index.

items.name: func joined() -> FlattenSequence<AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>>
items.desc: Returns the elements of this sequence of sequences, concatenated.

items.name: func joined<Separator>(separator: Separator) -> JoinedSequence<AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>>
items.desc: Returns the concatenated elements of this sequence of sequences, inserting the given separator between each element.

items.name: func joined(separator: String) -> String
items.desc: Returns a new string by concatenating the elements of the sequence, adding the given separator between each element.

items.name: func joined(separator: String) -> String
items.desc: Returns a new string by concatenating the elements of the sequence, adding the given separator between each element.

items.name: func last(where: (Element) -> Bool) -> Element?
items.desc: Returns the last element of the sequence that satisfies the given predicate.

items.name: func lastIndex(of: Element) -> AnyIndex?
items.desc: Returns the last index where the specified value appears in the collection.

items.name: func lastIndex(where: (Element) -> Bool) -> AnyIndex?
items.desc: Returns the index of the last element in the collection that matches the given predicate.

items.name: func lexicographicallyPrecedes<OtherSequence>(OtherSequence) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the sequence precedes another sequence in a lexicographical (dictionary) ordering, using the less-than operator (<) to compare elements.

items.name: func lexicographicallyPrecedes<OtherSequence>(OtherSequence, by: (Element, Element) -> Bool) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the sequence precedes another sequence in a lexicographical (dictionary) ordering, using the given predicate to compare elements.

items.name: func makeIterator() -> AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Iterator
items.desc: Returns an iterator over the elements of this collection.

items.name: func max() -> Element?
items.desc: Returns the maximum element in the sequence.

items.name: func max(by: (Element, Element) -> Bool) -> Element?
items.desc: Returns the maximum element in the sequence, using the given predicate as the comparison between elements.

items.name: func min() -> Element?
items.desc: Returns the minimum element in the sequence.

items.name: func min(by: (Element, Element) -> Bool) -> Element?
items.desc: Returns the minimum element in the sequence, using the given predicate as the comparison between elements.

items.name: func popFirst() -> Element?
items.desc: Removes and returns the first element of the collection.

items.name: func popLast() -> Element?
items.desc: Removes and returns the last element of the collection.

items.name: func prefix(through: AnyIndex) -> AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>
items.desc: Returns a subsequence from the start of the collection through the specified position.

items.name: func prefix(upTo: AnyIndex) -> AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>
items.desc: Returns a subsequence from the start of the collection up to, but not including, the specified position.

items.name: func randomElement() -> Element?
items.desc: Returns a random element of the collection.

items.name: func randomElement<T>(using: inout T) -> Element?
items.desc: Returns a random element of the collection, using the given generator as a source for randomness.

items.name: func reduce<Result>(Result, (Result, Element) -> Result) -> Result
items.desc: Returns the result of combining the elements of the sequence using the given closure.

items.name: func reduce<Result>(into: Result, (inout Result, Element) -> ()) -> Result
items.desc: Returns the result of combining the elements of the sequence using the given closure.

items.name: func removeFirst() -> Element
items.desc: Removes and returns the first element of the collection.

items.name: func removeFirst(Int)
items.desc: Removes the specified number of elements from the beginning of the collection.

items.name: func removeLast() -> Element
items.desc: Removes and returns the last element of the collection.

items.name: func removeLast(Int)
items.desc: Removes the given number of elements from the end of the collection.

items.name: func reversed() -> ReversedCollection<AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>>
items.desc: Returns a view presenting the elements of the collection in reverse order.

items.name: func shuffled() -> [Element]
items.desc: Returns the elements of the sequence, shuffled.

items.name: func shuffled<T>(using: inout T) -> [Element]
items.desc: Returns the elements of the sequence, shuffled using the given generator as a source for randomness.

items.name: func sorted() -> [Element]
items.desc: Returns the elements of the sequence, sorted.

items.name: func sorted(by: (Element, Element) -> Bool) -> [Element]
items.desc: Returns the elements of the sequence, sorted using the given predicate as the comparison between elements.

items.name: func split(maxSplits: Int, omittingEmptySubsequences: Bool, whereSeparator: (Element) -> Bool) -> [AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>]
items.desc: Returns the longest possible subsequences of the collection, in order, that don’t contain elements satisfying the given predicate.

items.name: func split(separator: Element, maxSplits: Int, omittingEmptySubsequences: Bool) -> [AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>]
items.desc: Returns the longest possible subsequences of the collection, in order, around elements equal to the given element.

items.name: func split(separator: Element, maxSplits: Int, omittingEmptySubsequences: Bool) -> [ArraySlice<Element>]
items.desc: Returns the longest possible subsequences of the sequence, in order, around elements equal to the given element.

items.name: func starts<PossiblePrefix>(with: PossiblePrefix) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the initial elements of the sequence are the same as the elements in another sequence.

items.name: func starts<PossiblePrefix>(with: PossiblePrefix, by: (Element, PossiblePrefix.Element) -> Bool) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the initial elements of the sequence are equivalent to the elements in another sequence, using the given predicate as the equivalence test.

items.name: func suffix(from: AnyIndex) -> AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>
items.desc: Returns a subsequence from the specified position to the end of the collection.

items.name: func withContiguousStorageIfAvailable<R>((UnsafeBufferPointer<Element>) -> R) -> R?
items.desc: Executes a closure on the sequence’s contiguous storage.

items.name: subscript(Range<AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index>) -> AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.SubSequence
items.desc: Accesses a contiguous subrange of the collection’s elements.

items.name: subscript(AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>.Index) -> Element
items.desc: Accesses the element indicated by position.

items.name: subscript<R>(R) -> AnyBidirectionalCollection<Element>
items.desc: Accesses the contiguous subrange of the collection’s elements specified by a range expression.
